intro: Appendicula oblonga, commonly known as the narrow-leafed appendicula, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically tubular with two lips, a characteristic feature of the Gesneriaceae family. Appendicula oblonga is often found in shaded, moist environments, thriving in the understory of tropical forests.
